items.title: Keyboard input focus
items.body:
We have quite a few tickets open regarding issues with keyboard input.
I had fixed some before, but new ones popup because people try with other hosts and those fail to send events or cardinal fails to receive them.
Anyhow, let's consolidate them all in a single ticket, make it a new one in order to start fresh.

References: #297 #245 #234 #232 #205 #159 #32 #24

Let's start fresh and assume nothing works.
We create a table with possible daws/hosts and test one by one, adjusting to match current situation.
If not fully supported or a workaround is possible, it is written in the extra notes.

Verified to work needs to pass this criteria: (working in all scenarios)
- on first load
- closing ui and reopening
- clicking away from ui to the daw/host, and to the plugin again
- clicking away from daw/host (to another application), and back to the plugin
- after resizing, closing and reopening
- with 2 instances open (different variants if possible)
- with 2 instances, closing one and reopening while the other stays open (if possible)
- with 2 instances, closing both and reopening

For Linux versions, it must be stated under which DE it was tested on, and also X11 or Wayland.

items.title: Multi-thread incompatibility?
items.body:
I'm using the LV2 version of Cardinal ("regular" — i.e. not FX nor Synth) in Reaper under windows 10 with an AMD Ryzen 7 3700 (8 cores, 16 threads) processor.

Everything works perfectly (multi-channel midi in/output, host parameter modulation, sidechain audio in/out, 16x oversampling, etc.) except for the fact that the performance meter in Cardinal always shows a CPU usage 16 times higher than the one in Reaper (67.5% vs 4.2% with my current patch).
I've loaded the same patch in the VST3 version and got the same issue.

I'm guessing that Cardinal sticks to 1 of the 16 threads, which highly limits its potential (and/or prevents me from oversampling it).

Am I right? And is there any solution?

![Cardinal+Reaper CPU usage](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25763261/178452059-cac18719-4c06-4368-bb0f-94a85b595563.png)

items.title: Discussion and development of web/wasm version
items.body:
For those unaware, https://cardinal.kx.studio/ is totally a thing now for some reason.
Also https://minicardinal.kx.studio/ for a mini/stripped-down version that loads faster.

There are some issues and things still to do.
Because this is for playground and testing and fun, and not all that serious, let's not open more than 1 ticket for web related things.
Everything web/wasm related should be on this ticket.

Stuff to do or implement:
- [x] audio input
- [ ] touch events
- [x] clipboard (do fake internal one if not possible to expose in browser)
- [x] webmidi
- [ ] host time controls (on menu bar, providing fake but valid BBT values)
- [x] intro message explaining what it all is, what to expect etc
- [x] detect incompatible browser setups and refuse to even load (noscript, no simd, no webgl2)
- [x] build libsndfile and fftw for extra module features
- [ ] minimum gui size (CSS is enough?)
- [x] allow url parameters to tweak page behaviour, also load patches as base64 encoded string
- [x] test loading all modules and disable those with custom non-GLES2 compat code

Known issues:
- [x] Loading zst compressed project file fails to load patch.json
- [ ] opening salamonis-mono-regen example patch triggers an exception
- [x] going full screen can mess up with the viewport size and coordinates
- [x] ctrl+a clears all text
- [x] audiofile player is missing regular audio support (only mp3 works)
- [x] audiofile and midifile inside ildaeil fail to show file dialogs
- [x] latest changes made performance in chrome worse?? firefox still fine..
- [x] compressed data assets > 50Mb
- [x] missing versioning to js, wasm and data downloads
(so they are updated automatically when reopening the page as needed)

Stuff to fix or workaround:
- [x] apply high-dpi event offset
- [x] test and implement fractional scaling "high-dpi" (only supports 2x and 3x now)
- [x] prevent ctrl/cmd+ shortcut keys from going to the browser
- [x] prevent browser from zooming the page
- [x] oddities with mouse down and leaving browser window

Undecided:
- [ ] host parameters
- [ ] host cv
- [x] persistent storage (client-side browser DB)
- [x] bundle a few simple LV2 plugins (mda, caps, tap, etc)

items.title: Cardinal for Windows won't run on Linux/Wine
items.body:
I tried Cardinal for the first time today and... well, I didn't. It didn't run at all. I tried it on Mulab 9 running on Linux and Wine.

I also tried it with carla-single, and it crashes instantly. I dragged it into Carla and it loads, I can even play something in Carla's piano roll and hear sound, but the plugin crashes when I click the cogwheel icon to view its GUI.

At first, I tried the 32-bit version because I prefer 32-bit. I know you've had problems with Win 32-bit so I tried the 64-bit version. The 64-bit version won't even load in Carla or carla-single.

I know what you're thinking. "There is a native Linux version."

I downloaded that too, tried it on Waveform 11, and it failed the scanning process test so Waveform won't load it at all.

There is no way for me to run Cardinal.

Apart from the problem with the Linux version, I am very disappointed to see that Cardinal for Windows won't run on Wine. I am using Linux Waveform for now, but intend to use more Mulab than Waveform in the future. I think Mulab is a better DAW than Waveform and the fact that it's made for Windows only makes it more attractive for me. Plugins can run "natively" rather than on linvst therefore they're more stable, and Windows applications never expire. Linux applications expire. I am guessing that Linux Cardinal won't run for me because I am using Debian Stretch. Must be some library miismatch. There is none of that problem with Windows apps so I absolutely prefer them.

BTW, the Windows version of Carla won't load in Wine either.

It's reported, for whatever it's worth. Thank you for your attention.

items.title: Set custom namespace for DISTRHO and DGL
items.body:
If we end up with `DGL_PuglWindow` as namespace for DGL things on macOS, this can easily conflict with other DPF based plugins.
Best to set a custom one, could also be based on cardinal version.

items.title: Make demo patches template:true
items.body:
When Cardinal is installed system-wide, loading these files should not be done the usual way.
The files should be used as templates, with a save operation asking where to save them instead of trying to override system files.

items.body:
I feel like I'm doing something critically wrong, when trying to load up the plugin, nothing happens in Ableton and when I try to open the standalone, an error "Failed to create JACK client, reason was: Communication error with JACK server."

I downloaded the Windows 64 bit exe installer and it did install the files to what I assume is the correct locations, but I'm completely lost on what to do to fix the error.

Please don't bash me too hard for making a dumb mistake, I'm very new to this kind of thing.

items.title: Audio meter drops to 0 when DAW window in not in focus
items.body:
Hi,

I just started using Cardinal in REAPER on macOS and noticed an issue. When I switch from REAPER to another window, the sounds generated by Cardinal will stop and the audio meters in REAPER will drop to 0 as well. From my initial testings, the issue only appears in both VST3 and LV2 versions of Cardinal, and doesn't appear in any versions of CardinalFX or Cardinal Synth.

Technical details:

MacBook Pro 13 inch (2018), Intel i7
macOS Monterey 12.4(21F79)
Cardinal-macOS-intel-22.5
REAPER 6.61

items.title: Decrease scrolling speed to Rack's default on macOS
items.body: Cardinal inherits scroll value multiplication from Rack, but because of differences in GUI stack on macOS we get scrolling speed that is way over the top (x10 comparing to Rack, where it is somewhat optimal, at least scrolling using trackpad feels natural and consistent with other applications). And this dramatically worsens user experience (at least it is how it was for me, most likely for others too).

items.title: Remote host and port should be configurable
items.body:
Cardinal has a great feature to automatically update a remote embedded instance, originally for the MOD devices. I'm currently trying to get Cardinal onto [Zynthian](https://zynthian.org/), where this functionality would also be very useful. Cardinal itself runs fine there as LV2, by the way (compiled on Raspberry Pi 4). 

However, Cardinal has the remote host and port [hardcoded](https://github.com/DISTRHO/Cardinal/blob/20e6f30bcc6fe6aa0889a6c4d51daaee1ef955ee/src/CardinalCommon.hpp#L24) to 192.168.51.1:2228. Zynthian is its own actual network device, and often doesn't have a fixed IP address or hostname. Hence, it'd be nice if this can be read from a configuration file.

I realize that no configuration file exists yet, and currently all user settings are stored as plugin data. I think we could do this in a few ways:

A) Introduce a configuration file
B) Configure this from environment variables

(A) would be the way to go if there are other settings that might want to live there (e.g. framerate skip, which typically wouldn't differ from instance to instance)

(B) would work as an initial approach, but it'd be messy since you'd have to set the environment variables for the host running Cardinal (if not standalone) and hope they make it across.

Any thoughts?

items.title: -fno-gnu-unique flag should be set not based on OS but based on compiler, and clang doesn't know about it
items.body:
clang fails because of this flag.

Many places in code set this flag for non-MacOS and non-Windows. This is wrong - it should be based on compiler.


clang-12 on FreeBSD 13

items.body:
I'm unfortunately unable to remember which build I'm using as I renamed the folder. But this appears to only affect bidoo modules. The sample is missing from the module whether it's a preset in my daw, a saved project in reaper, or a patch. It remembers slider/knob position, but the sample is no longer loaded when I save the patch through one of these methods and later come back to it after closing it. Sometimes it even causes a crash, like in this patch:

[crash_patch.zip](https://github.com/DISTRHO/Cardinal/files/8741132/crash_patch.zip)

Linux mint 20 64 bit, cinnamon, present in reaper and carla and standalone and all other variants(vst3, vst2, lv2)

items.title: Unable to regain keyboard focus after clicking away in Renoise (VST)
items.body: Upon first loading Renoise and entering the VST window, keyboard input works in Cardinal, however upon clicking away and using the keyboard in the DAW, the plugin will stop responding to keyboard inputs. This may be preceded by a short period of laggy/intermittent response before it stops responding entirely. The "enable keyboard" checkbox at the bottom of the plugin window successfully stops the keyboard signals going to the DAW but has no effect on the responsiveness of the plugin.

items.title: Resizing GUI does not work in Reaper correctly (22.05)
items.body:
If I drag using the corner tool, it allows me to make the plugin window bigger, but its just empty white space that appears and the GUI remains the same. Unless, I drag to resize the bottom or sides of the window (but NOT the corner tool). I was able to resize the GUI by double clicking to make it full screen - in this case it does resize correctly. Odd behaviour, there is a chance you already know but I looked through the issues and didn't see anything obvious so I thought I'd report it. :).

EDIT: It turns out I can resize by the corner as long as I make sure that I click on the absolute pixel perfect corner of the window, and not the corner tool. It is also possible to resize the window so that the corner tool disappears entirely, then i have to resize the actual plugin window itself, and it refreshes. Hopefully this makes sense.

items.title: Feature request: "Favorite" modules selection
items.body:
VCV Rack has, i believe (I don't actually use it, but I've seen it in some videos) a Favorites option for modules, so you can save a selection of favorite modules for quick access on the module browser.

I'm guessing Cardinal does not have it because it doesn't save config files in the first place; however, I've been saving settings (like plugin size, control preferences and the default patch) via updating the default VST preset... Thus, if a "favorite" system were to be implemented and could persist in a plugin preset, it would be immensely helpful, especially when keyboard support is still a little jank, which makes the search for modules that little bit more cumbersome in the first place.

items.title: issues showing some modules
items.body:
Hey Felipe, 
I've been following the evolution and the development of this project for quite some time already - and first of all, I just want to thank you for the efforts you added to develop this tool for us - the musicians and music producers.  I can feel there is hard work behind and your involvement is amazing. So I really appreciate a lot your work and the fact you keep this project alive involving that much by constantly improving it.

Considering that after 15 years of using Ableton as my main daw, I was about to abandon against for the incredible possibilities that these eurorack emulations opened for me, then I discovered Cardinal and I said that might be the right thing for me.  Because I started to use Cardinal as my main thing to create and generate new sounds + ideas for my productions - pretty much the whole creative process - I desperately wanted to be able to have a version with  Fundamental modules inside.
 I know this might sound odd, but I'm using these modules a lot in my projects,  helps me to save a lot of  CPU and by tweaking or messing around with them, it brings me the results I'm looking for.

So I've been waiting and researching on my own a lot - to find a possibility and resolution of my issue, as I never had the chance to see them in Cardinal 22.03 (the version I use to work with) ,  but many times I wondered if my daw got an issue (and maybe it's not able to read the vst file as supposed - at least older builds)  - and basically I just have no luck at all because of the .dll files might be glitching "communicating" proper along with daw.
I have to mention I'm quite new to this GitHub community and I don't do code at all, so I had to deal just with the built files I was able to find) . 

In the beginning, I just tough maybe there are not included and I believe that probably is not that easy, and I just preferred to  a few months for future releases hoping that will show up  (checking constantly the table with possible future add-ons to be included and a good reason for them) 

then I noticed that some youtube guys had them with cardinal -   so probably I considered that I might check a different version, I started to make some researches, and I tried some other versions you released,  having them scanned by the daw.

I ended up installing and testing about 10 versions and seems that only recent builds [22.03/ 22.04] are scanned and detected easily, but by checking the module lists (neither synth or fx)  there is no such thing in regards of the fundamental library.

However, in the older versions, Ableton stays on "scanning Cardinal...."   (for hours) -  and nothing happens even once I let them be "scanned" for 6 hours. I tough maybe my daw got stuck on this scanning process - just because I'm dealing with old versions that are a bit outdated, and the .dll files don't work in an optimized way along with the daw.
 I canceled the scan, reopened the daw, and these builts will show up in the VST lists, so the daw recognizes them, but it still look like something is messed up, and what I got confused me even more: 

v22.03 + some older releases actually contain the  "VCV" label in the library, the thing is that
in v22.03 inside was only one module - the filter VCF. (which has black skin and looked a bit different than the original, but the controls and positions of them were the same, but that was the only module ) . 

So, after so many attempts by downloading and scanning different builds/updates (of the same [or not] release version) giving me the same thing, I decided to install the .exe version,  -  but this one doesn't ask in the installation process to pick up a VST directory path and its not detected by my daw at all.  [even I included the default VSTPlugins folder for x64 vst 2 from Program Files]

After all this, 
I went searching for some even way older versions -  hoping that I will see the package there - no matter that the module base its limited;
 In the end,  I was able to find one version released around November last year [a00020e5 tagged], with about 400 modules, and with this one, I finally got the full Fundamental collection,  so I tough my problem its solved and I will use this
but shortly I realized that my daw is detecting this as an effect plugin, exactly like the FX version instead of Synth one -  [ and no matter how many trials for installations or workarounds I did thru scan process in my daw - I manage to get only one file -  
 there was no synth version and no FX version, just a single file called "Cardinal" - but behaving like an effect.

I almost gave up just to accept the fact I won't ever have them, but yesterday in the morning I  started to search again and I also saw somewhere something that we should forget about these modules as won't be ever available due to some policy of the VCV rack. ( I  believe that was the whole idea of that post, I might be wrong, but I'm not able to find that topic anymore. So, I kindly ask you if it's possible to recommend to me a version that got all this collection inside and behaves like the Synth? 
Did Cardinal use to have them only in primary versions and later on the collection was removed? If yes, might any small chance to see them in the future?
 I don't care If will have to use an initial version that only got a few collections as long as it contains the full Fundamental package on it.
 I don't know what else I could do,  and I feel so unlucky by struggling to resolve this, maybe reinstall my daw, rescan my stuff and try again, or I just have to forget completely about them as won't be any possibility to have these modules there. 
Thank you so much for your time checking this.
Maria

items.title: Host Audio: Left/Mono channel behavior is unexpected / different from VCV Rack
items.body:
Left channel is mono when nothing is connected to the right channel: when only left channel is receiving something, audio comes out of both channels, and it's apparently not possible to have a silent right channel without connecting something to the right channel. This is different from VCV Rack / Audio8 where odd channels are left only, and even channels right only.

If that's indeed the desired approach, then maybe a couple of words of explanation may help? (hover text only says "#1 input").

The UI is also a little confusing; the big "level" knob looks too much like a pan control, and the levels above it display intensity for both channels. Not sure if a level control is needed here.

items.title: Feature Request: MIDI Note Retrigger
items.body:
First of all, this is a wonderful project! it's getting me back into the world of VCV and modular synthesis!

One thing that I think is lacking from Cardinal that is in base VCV rack is MIDI note retrigger. While you don't really need this feature for polyphonic patches (as it is basically built-in to how polyphony works), it is almost essential if you are trying to make a monophonic synth patch for example. Retrigger is useful outside of that for other types of patches as well. A good use case is for re-triggering envelopes, or resetting oscillators.
